alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee and southeastern Osceola Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 255 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles north of Kissimmee Prairie Preserve, or 10 miles south of Lake Marian, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Kissimmee, Lake Marian, Kenansville and Kissimmee Prairie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
